captive.description: This section can be used to setup a captive portal on the AP.

downloadquota.description: The maximum download quota for a specific client.

downloadrate.description: The maximum download rate for a specific client.

enabled.description: Enable this option to tell the unit that it shall start a captive portal.

gatewayfqdn.description: The fqdn used for the captive portal IP.

gatewayname.description: This name will be presented to connecting users in on the splash page.

maxclients.description: The number of clients that we accept.

uploadquota.description: The maximum upload quota for a specific client.

uploadrate.description: The maximum upload rate for a specific client.

lldp_description.description: The content that we shall announce inside the description field.

location.description: The content that we shall announce inside the location field.

log_hostname.description: Hostname to send to remote syslog. If none is provided, the actual hostname is send.

log_ip.description: IP address of a syslog server to which the log messages should be sent in addition to the local destination.

log_port.description: Port number of the remote syslog server specified with log_ip.

log_proto.description: Sets the protocol to use for the connection, either tcp or udp.

log_size.description: Size of the file based log buffer in KiB. This value is used as the fallback value for log_buffer_size if the latter is not specified.

mqtt.description: The option that configure which mqtt server the unit should connect to.

enable.description: Enable this option if you would like the unit to connect to the MQTT backend.

password.description: The password that is used to authenticate.

port.description: This option defines the port that we connect to.

server.description: the IP/URL of the MQTT server.

username.description: The username that is used to authenticate.

items.description: This section allows you to configure your networks.

dhcp.description: The DHCP configuration of the network interface.

leasetime.description: This defines how many hours the leases should be valid for. (12h, 30m, ...)

limit.description: This defines how many leasable IP addresses are available.

start.description: This defines which number shall be used as the first leasable IP address.

disabled.description: This option allows use to disable a network interface.

dns.description: The IPv4 DNS server that shall be assigned to the network interface.

gateway.description: The IPv4 gateway that shall be assigned to the network interface.

ip6assign.description: The prefix delegation mask that the interface shall use.

ipaddr.description: The IPv4 address that shall be assigned to the network interface.

ipv6.description: The IPv6 operation mode of this interface. When set to "upstream", the system will attempt to acquire an IPv6 address and prefix through DHCPv6-PD and SLAAC. When set to "downstream", DHCPv6 and router advertisements will be offered. Setting "none" will inhibit any IPv6 configuration.

ipv6_dhcpmode.description: Specifies the DHCPv6 operation mode on downstream interfaces. When set to "stateless", the system will announce router advertisements only, without offering stateful DHCPv6 service. When set to "stateful", emitted router advertisements will instruct clients to obtain a DHCPv6 lease. When set to "hybrid", clients can freely chose whether to self- assign a random address through SLAAC, whether to request an address via DHCPv6, or both. For maximum compatibility with different clients, it is recommended to use the hybrid mode. The special mode "relay" will instruct the unit to act as DHCPv6 relay between this interface and any of the IPv6 interfaces in "upstream" mode.

ipv6_reqprefixlen.description: Specifies the IPv6 prefix size that should be requested on upstream interfaces.

leases.description: A list of static dhcp leases assigned to the interface.

hostname.description: The hostname address used by this static lease.

ip.description: The IP address used by this static lease.

mac.description: The MAC address used by this static lease.

lldp.description: Should LLDP be started on this network.

mdns.description: Should MDNS be started on this network.

metric.description: The routing metric of an interface. Lower values have higher priority.

mtu.description: The MTU that shall be used by the network interface.

netmask.description: The IPv4 netmask that shall be assigned to the network interface.

peeraddr.description: The remote tunnel endpoint that we want to connect to.

port.description: The network port that shall be used.

proto.description: The configuration that shall be run on the network interface.

mode.description: This defines if the network interface shall be bridged directly with the WAN side or shall be NAT'ed out from LAN.

name.description: This option allows us to override the uci naming for NAT and guest networks.

vlan.description: The VID that shall be assign to packets leaving this network interface.

enable_server.description: Enable this option if you would like the unit to enable a downstream NTP server for its connected clients.

enabled.description: Enable this option to tell the unit that it shall get its time from an upstream NTP server. The servers are defined by the <servers> attribute.

server.description: This is an array of URL/IP of the upstream NTP servers that the unit shall use to acquire its current time.

ema.description: Enableing this option will make the phy broadcast its multiple BSSID beacons using EMA.

he_bss_color.description: This enables BSS Coloring on the PHY. setting it to 0 disables the feature 1-63 sets the color and 64 will make hostapd pick a random color.

multiple_bssid.description: Enabling this option will make the phy broadcast its BSSs using the multiple BSSID beacon IE.

poe.description: This Object allows you to en/disable PoE on a network port.

ports.description: This is an array of the PoE state of the ports. any value other than 0 will enable PoE on a port.

host.description: The server that we want to connect to

interface.description: The interface that shall be used to connect to the server.

port.description: This option defines the port that we connect to.

token.description: The security token that we use to authenticate with the server.

PasswordAuth.description: Define if password based auth is allowed or not for user accounts.

Port.description: This option defines which port the SSH server shall be available on.

RootPasswordAuth.description: Define if password based auth is allowed or not for the root account.

allow_wan.description: Should the ssh server be made available on the wan port.

authorized_keys.description: this allows the upload of public ssh keys. Keys need to be seperated by a newline.

enable.description: Enable this option if you would like to enable the SSH server on the unit.

ssid.description: This is a list of all our SSIDs that shall be configured. Mapping of PHY/SSID is done via the "band" property.

band.description: The list of wifi bands that the SSID should be broadcasted on. This value can be [ 2, 5, 5l, 5u, 6 ].

acct_server.description: RADIUS accounting server to handle client authentication.

anqp_domain_id.description: ANQP Domain ID, An identifier for a set of APs in an ESS that share the same common ANQP information.

bssid.description: Override the BSSID of the network, only applicable in adhoc or sta mode. In wds mode specifies the BSSID of another AP to create WDS with.

civic.description: The content of a location civic measurement subelement

dtim_period.description: Set the DTIM (delivery traffic information message) period. There will be one DTIM per this many beacon frames. This may be set between 1 and 255. This option only has an effect on ap wifi-ifaces.

ft_psk_generate_local.description: Whether to generate FT response locally for PSK networks. This avoids use of PMK-R1 push/pull from other APs with FT-PSK networks as the required information (PSK and other session data) is already locally available.

ftm_responder.description: Publish fine timing measurement (FTM) responder functionality.

hidden.description: Disables the broadcasting of beacon frames if set to 1 and, in doing so, hides the ESSID.

hs20_oper_friendly_name.description: This parameter can be used to configure one or more Operator Friendly Name Duples.

isolate.description: Isolates wireless clients from each other

iw_network_auth_type.description: Network Authentication Type. This parameter indicates what type of network authentication is used in the network.

iw_venue_group.description: Venue Info group. The available values are defined in IEEE Std 802.11u-2011, 7.3.1.34

iw_venue_name.description: This parameter can be used to configure one or more Venue Name Duples for Venue Name ANQP information.

iw_venue_type.description: Venue Info type. The available values are defined in IEEE Std 802.11u-2011, 7.3.1.34

iw_venue_url.description: Venue URL information This parameter can be used to configure one or more Venue URL Duples to provide additional information corresponding to Venue Name information.

key.description: In any WPA-PSK mode, this is a string that specifies the pre-shared passphrase from which the pre-shared key will be derived.

lci.description: The content of a LCI measurement subelement

mode.description: Selects the operation mode of the wireless network interface controller.

network.description: Specifies the network interface to attach the wireless to.

operator_icon.description: Operator icons are specified using references to the hs20_icon entries.

osen.description: OSU Server-Only Authenticated L2 Encryption Network

rate_egress.decription: Stations will be limited to this egress rate given in mbit.

rate_ingress.decription: Stations will be limited to this ingress rate given in mbit.

server.description: RADIUS server to handle client authentication.

ssid.description: The broadcasted SSID of the wireless network and for for managed mode the SSID of the network you’re connecting to

stationary_ap.description: Stationary AP config indicates that the AP doesn't move.

time_zone.description: The Timezone of the AP. Setting this value will enable the "Time Advertisement" IE int he beacon.

stats.description: This section defines what stats and metric the unit should send to the cloud backend.

interval.description: This allows use to define how often the data should be sent. Values are in minutes. A value of 0 disables stats/metric reporting.

lldp.description: The unit shall report its LLDP neighbours.

neighbours.description: The unit shall report its learned neighbour table.

pids.description: The unit shall report its process table.

poe.description: The unit shall report its current PoE state.

serviceprobe.description: The unit shall report its service probe results (dhcp, dns, radius, ...).

system.description: The unit shall report its basic system info (load, memory consumption, ...).

traffic.description: The unit shall report its network traffic counters.

wifiiface.description: The unit shall report its wifi ifaces.

wifistation.description: The unit shall report its wifi stations.

steer.description: This section describes the band steering behaviour of the unit.

enabled.description: Enable this option to tell the unit that it shall paticipate in the netwrok wide steering

network.description: The network that shall be used to communicate with the other peers.

hostname.description: This allows you to change the hostname of the device.

timezone.description: This allows you to change the TZ of the device.
